title: Hero HF Deluxe Pro launched at Rs 73,550
description: Hero MotoCorp has launched the HF Deluxe Pro, a new variant that sits on top of the HF range in Hero’s commuter portfolio and is priced at Rs 73,550 (ex-showroom, Delhi). Hero HF Deluxe Pro gets an LED headlight with DRL  Features stop-start tech and 18-inch tubeless tyres Rivals the likes of the Honda Shine 100 DX What’s different with the HF Deluxe Pro? It occupies the top spot in Hero’s HF range The HF Deluxe Pro gets a notable feature bump, including a segment-first LED headlamp with a crown-shaped daylight running lamp, a new digital speedometer with a low fuel indicator and refreshed body graphics. The Pro also comes equipped with Hero’s i3S stop-start tech, which is also available with the HF Deluxe and helps improve fuel efficiency in stop-go traffic.  In terms of safety and comfort, it gets 18-inch wheels with tubeless tyres, a preload-adjustable rear suspension and drum brakes at both ends. HF Deluxe Pro engine and specs It uses the same engine as the Hero Splendor and HF 100 Powering the HF Deluxe Pro is the same 97.2cc single-cylinder air-cooled engine, producing 7.9hp at 8,000rpm and 8.05Nm at 6,000rpm, mated to a 4-speed gearbox. HF Deluxe Pro price and positioning Priced Rs 2,282 more than the HF Deluxe The Hero HF Deluxe Pro is priced at Rs 73,550, which is Rs 2,282 more than the HF Deluxe, which costs Rs 71,268. It rivals other commuter motorcycles like the Honda Shine 100 DX, which was unveiled today, with a similar focus on value with added features and bling. Also see: Hero Karizma XMR Base variant discontinued
author: Ved Janve
excerpt: The HF Deluxe Pro adds a few modern touches, such as an LCD dash and an LED headlight.

html:
The HF Deluxe Pro adds a few modern touches, such as an LCD dash and an LED headlight.

Hero MotoCorp has launched the HF Deluxe Pro, a new variant that sits on top of the HF range in Hero’s commuter portfolio and is priced at Rs 73,550 (ex-showroom, Delhi).

  1. Hero HF Deluxe Pro gets an LED headlight with DRL 
  2. Features stop-start tech and 18-inch tubeless tyres
  3. Rivals the likes of the Honda Shine 100 DX

What’s different with the HF Deluxe Pro?

It occupies the top spot in Hero’s HF range

The HF Deluxe Pro gets a notable feature bump, including a segment-first LED headlamp with a crown-shaped daylight running lamp, a new digital speedometer with a low fuel indicator and refreshed body graphics. The Pro also comes equipped with Hero’s i3S stop-start tech, which is also available with the HF Deluxe and helps improve fuel efficiency in stop-go traffic. 

In terms of safety and comfort, it gets 18-inch wheels with tubeless tyres, a preload-adjustable rear suspension and drum brakes at both ends.

HF Deluxe Pro engine and specs

It uses the same engine as the Hero Splendor and HF 100

Powering the HF Deluxe Pro is the same 97.2cc single-cylinder air-cooled engine, producing 7.9hp at 8,000rpm and 8.05Nm at 6,000rpm, mated to a 4-speed gearbox.

HF Deluxe Pro price and positioning

Priced Rs 2,282 more than the HF Deluxe

The Hero HF Deluxe Pro is priced at Rs 73,550, which is Rs 2,282 more than the HF Deluxe, which costs Rs 71,268. It rivals other commuter motorcycles like the Honda Shine 100 DX, which was unveiled today, with a similar focus on value with added features and bling.

Also see:

Hero Karizma XMR Base variant discontinued
